article.title: D2D User Selection For Simultaneous Spectrum Sharing And Energy Harvesting

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the "Phase 2" in Figure 1 represent?
choices: The phase where all D2D users transmit simultaneously.
The phase where the selected D2D user transmits to the cellular user.
The phase where the cellular base station transmits to all users.
The phase where the D2D users harvest energy from the environment.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the effect of increasing the fraction of time allocated to phase 1 (α) on the outage probability of the cellular network?
choices: Increasing α always decreases the outage probability.
Increasing α always increases the outage probability.
Increasing α initially decreases the outage probability, but after a certain point, it starts increasing.
Increasing α has no effect on the outage probability.

multiple_choice_question.text: Why does the simulated outage probability of the D2D network decrease with increasing α, unlike the theoretical curves?
choices: The theoretical model does not consider the impact of energy harvesting.
The simulation uses a different path loss exponent than the theoretical model.
The simulation assumes a different number of D2D users than the theoretical model.
The theoretical model does not consider the possibility of D2D users being located very close to the cellular user.

multiple_choice_question.text: In Case 3 of Table 1, why is the signal received at DU<sub>2</sub> represented as √(T - φ)P<sub>1</sub>h<sub>21</sub>x<sub>1</sub> + n<sub>2</sub>?
choices: DU<sub>2</sub> is receiving signals from both the cellular base station and DU<sub>1</sub>.
DU<sub>2</sub> is only receiving the signal from DU<sub>1</sub>, which is transmitting for the remaining time in phase 1 (T-φ).
DU<sub>2</sub> is only receiving the signal from the base station, and the term √(T - φ) represents the reduced time slot.
DU<sub>2</sub> is harvesting energy in this case, and the equation represents the energy harvested.
